nodes.title: Portrait d'un chef de village en Mauritanie. (Photo by Michel HUET/Gamma-Rapho via Getty Images)
The ancient city of Chinguetti, Mauritania, in the Sahara was once a rich center in the salt trade before the arrival of European sailing ships to the African coast.
CARAVANE DE FEMMES DANS LA REGION DE NEMA, MAURITANIE. (Photo by Maurice ASCANI/Gamma-Rapho via Getty Images)
OASIS EN MAURITANIE REGION DE CHINGUETTI (Photo by Michel RENAUDEAU/Gamma-Rapho via Getty Images)
MAURITANIE,MINE DE SEL DE SEBKET EJ JILL  (Photo by Michel RENAUDEAU/Gamma-Rapho via Getty Images)
Mauritanien présentant un manuscrit enluminé du XIIè siècle à Chinguetti, circa 1990, Mauritanie. (Photo by Jean-Luc MANAUD/Gamma-Rapho via Getty Images)
MAURITANIE, NOUHADIBOU. (Photo by Michel RENAUDEAU/Gamma-Rapho via Getty Images)

Mauritanian musician Dimi Mint Abba (1958 - 2011) sings and plays an ardin, a 14-string harp-lute, against a white background in the studio, New York, New York, September 24, 1993. (Photo by Jack Vartoogian/Getty Images)
A small group of French tourists retrace ancient caravan routes between dying Mauritanian oasis towns (George Steinmetz)
Mauritania, Senegal river, sunset - CIRCA 1900: Mauritania - Senegal river, sunset. (Photo By DEA / C. SAPPA/De Agostini via Getty Images)
